intro: Pedicularis decora, commonly known as the decorated lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments and has a distinctive appearance with bright red or orange flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. The flowers are tubular with two lips, and they attract pollinators such as bees and flies.
